review.reviewBody: I can’t believe this vest has such good reviews. I bought this two years ago for marathon training and this is my third summer with it. For the price of this vest I’ve been stuck with it but let this be a warning to you if you are a runner. Your back will be so ripped up from this vest, wearing a T-shirt, don’t even bother wearing only a sports bra even when it’s 80 degrees. My back is so badly chaffed from this vest, I am in so much pain every time I have to wear it. I finally ordered a new vest and feel bad even selling my used one to someone. If you want welts on your back, great vest for that.
review.name: Do not buy.

review.reviewBody: I have a Dyna 1.5 that I bought in 2021. The zippered pocket recently began tearing so I went to pick up a new version since I frequently store my keys and a credit card in that pocket. Biggest problem right off the bat is that this update is much longer than the previous but kind of just hangs off your chest below the bust, it does not conform to your body under the bust. The version I have stops right at the bottom of a sports bra, so no chafe if you're running in just a bra. But the sides on this version are so long and loose under the bust, it's a chafeing disaster waiting to happen and was uncomfortable against my skin on just a 4 mile run. There are also no straps on the side to adjust the tightness, and the straps across the chest are thin and flimsy. This pack no longer comes with the magentic keeper for the straw - so I took the keeper from my old pack off and put it on these straps and even that has major downsides. This pack forces you to feed the straw over the the right shoulder, but the tabs to unclip the front straps are still on the right, so if you use the magnetic keeper, you have to undo it from the magnet and let it flop around as you take the pack off, as opposed to feeding the straw over the left shoulder so the magnet can remain latched when you unclip the strap. Just all around a huge downgrade from my current model, after just one run I will be returning to the retailer where I purchased. And it appears that every running vest Osprey is currently selling has all these features, so no alternatives within the brand.
review.name: Huge downgrade from previous version

review.reviewBody:
I got this after finding that my waist belt with water bottle was not enough water for my runs. For refence I am 5ft 3in, a 38G. I bought a size large and while it was snug I did have space around the bottom. One of my issue is the front straps. I just don't think they will hold up once i get running. My other issue with the fit is how the front of the vest just seemed to stay on the sides of my chest. So all in all the women's fit does not work for a plus size runner. I switched it out for the men's Large, hopefully it works out better. 
Run Happy!
review.name: Not for big busted women

review.reviewBody: At the time of purchase I couldn?t justify paying a lot for a full face knowing that I?d only use it a few times a year. I?d had a couple concussions prior to purchasing this helmet, and this helmet didn?t save me from a third. Compared to the crashes that caused the other two concussions, the fall in this helmet was pretty mild and there?s not even any scratches on it. If you can afford a better helmet, then purchase it, your brain is worth it. Obviously this is a subjective and qualitative review, so take it with a grain of salt. There?s other factors that could have contributed to the concussion that I can?t account for.
review.name: Your brain is worth more money

review.reviewBody: I am always looking for a good pair of biking and running shorts. The fabric in these is so smooth and comfortable. They are comfy to wear and be active in but they are not remotely flattering. The fabric on the front is baggy and bunches up. It's almost like they built a front butt in to it!!
review.name: Amazing fabric but weird fit

review.reviewBody: I bought these shorts as part of my quest for the goldilocks of bike shorts... the right inseam, fabric, waistband, pockets... These check most of the boxes. I bought the green and the color is just as shown online, and the fabric is nice - not too compressive, but just enough. Sweat shows up pretty easily, but that'll be the case for anything but black. The fit is true to size. Things I'd suggest for the next version: the pockets in the waistband are a little shallow. I wouldn't put my phone back there because it will definitely fall out. They will hold a gel or key or card though. I know it's subjective, but I'd like a little higher rise. And lastly, the seams on the inseam. They're not flat, which could present some chafing issues at some point. Hasn't happened yet, but I haven't had these on anything longer than about 90 minutes so far. Overall a good short - but I'm still searching.
review.name: not quite perfect, but close!

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for tight biker shorts to run in that were longer and stayed put.  These are all of that and more!  Super soft material that does not ride up or slip down.  Have had zero chafing with these.  I live in the south and it's like running on the sun in the summertime.  Training for a fall marathon means lots of sweat and trying to stay as cool as possible.  I have every color in these shorts and they are all I have worn this summer.  My only complaint is the lack of pockets.  There is a small one at your back for GU's or your keys, but too small for a phone.   Side pockets would be a plus, but that's really all I can say negative. If you need summer running shorts ( also would be great for hiking or biking) get these. They run  pretty true to size.  I am 5'7 and 150 and wear a medium.  If you are between sizes I would day size down.
review.name: My go to summer running shorts!

name: Destination Run Bike Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: I purchased the undyed and really like it. It looks raw. The hip belt is comfy and removes easily to attach the brain around my waist. Plenty of room inside and the large pockets are great. Love that the pocket cinch straps can be run inside or on the outside of the pockets.
review.name: Great rucksack 🎒

review.reviewBody: The regular size is listed as 2 lbs, 6.4 oz. In the Backcountry.com website. Actual weight is 2 lbs, 12.2 oz.  That's about an extra 6 oz. that should not be there. I weighed it several times to be sure and then found others complaining online about the same thing getting the same weight measurement. I haven't decided whether to keep it or not, as it otherwise appears to be a nice pack with some nice features, but this is heavier than what I bargained for.   Hopefully, someone will update the site with the real weight. I just want others to know so they can make a fully informed decision.
review.name: Actual weight not advertised weight...

review.reviewBody: Bought it for hiking and canoe camping this summer as a lighter upgrade to my current pack. Ended up taking it out on a 4 day winter trip in Northern MN to break it in and it fit all my gear with a good amount of space left. The roll top feature came in handy for this, ill assume my summer kit will be much smaller in volume and that'll be nice. Not bad for a lightweight framed backpack. Was a comfortable carry over decent mileage for the most part. The only things I don't like is it's a little too big for my kit and I'm not a fan of the brain.
review.name: Awesome Light-ish pack

review.reviewBody:
I typically could care less for negative reviews on items I own. If it works for me - it works. If it doesn't work for you - then it doesn't. However, the other reviewer's thoughts on the bag seem really unwarranted and ignorant.

Yes, the bag is technically a white color but no.. the manufacturer is not wrong when they say the bag is not white. It's misleading - yes but not wrong. The bag is UNDYED, It was NOT dyed white. The color of the UNDYED fabric is naturally white-ish and it is NOT DYED WHITE! It looks exactly like the picture - some parts are bright white while some are off-white and some are grey.

The straps are long - yes, that is because it's intended for you to strap gear and not just act as a compression strap. The longest strap is the middle strap that keeps the main compartment closed. If the other review had actually used some critical thinking - they'd maybe discovered this. The backpack is a roll top with clips and then it has another super long strap in the middle then the brain goes over this. This long strap that the reviewer complained about is great for when you need to strap a tent to the top or a bear canister. You can then tuck the excess straps away. It's better to have a longer strap to give you options to strap down gear rather than straps that are too short and risk being useless!

The yellowing is maybe because THIS PACK IS UNDYED and NOT DYED WHITE. 

So if I'm defending this bag so much - why didn't I give it a full 5 stars? Because there are some issues that I think warrant negative points and not just opinions based on ignorance.

The negatives I have with the bag are:

1. The front pouch mesh is extremely loose. Anything you put in there may fall out if you do not really cinch the bag down or pack it full so there's outward pressure. The material is already stretchy which can make the bag feel cheap when it's both stretchy and loose.

2. The inner pouch that holds onto the frame sheet is oddly tight. When zipping up, it stretches the fabric to the point where it looks like the seams are receiving an unnecessary amount of tug which kind of causes some concern should I pack the bag more. I have no doubt the seems will hold but it's still concerning.

3. The straps are a tad on the thin side at only half an inch in width and the buckles are small. I've had the buckle unbuckle when cinching down my bag (my base weight is only about 18 lbs!) I would have liked to see a more robust buckle and wider straps.
review.name: The other review is questionable at best

review.reviewBody: The tags will tell you “This pack isn’t white, it’s not dyed.” Let me tell you, this pack is so white it can be seen from Mars. Nothing like the picture. Way too many straps that are way too long adding  unnecessary weight to an otherwise decently light pack. There are some spots where the pack has “yellowed” and it’s kinda gross. I returned it.
review.name: Bright White

name: Crown3 60L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of these shorts. I prefer baggies... but not too baggy. The features that make these shorts stand out to me are the perfectly placed pockets, low rise waist, and incredible flattering length/fit of the legs. The emerald color is a beautiful blue/green. I?m 5?9? and these are just above my knees, but taper nicely without being too fitted. I will save for other colors!
review.name: Great trail short

review.reviewBody: I purchased a small and medium of this short.  The medium was HUGH.  The small wasn't sung yet fit close.  Similar to road cycling shorts.  The length was at the knee so these will be great shorts when I need to wear knee pads for DH riding.  The waist was high in the back so when you lean over they don't fall down - no pinching either in the front or sides.  They were a close fit - not truly snug, however compared ot the medium, the short fit well.
review.name: Comfotable

review.reviewBody: I purchased a small and medium.  I kept the small.  The mediums were hugh overall.  The waist fit, however beyond that there was just too much short.  If you want something really loose these will work
review.name: HUGH!

review.reviewBody: In search of a new MTB wardrobe I tried the Lilium shorts, along with other styles in the Troy Lee Designs 2020 women?s line.  Lillium has become my go-to short all summer! High quality quick-drying stretch nylon, air flow perforations on the inner thighs, pockets in all the right places, and a superior wide waistband that keeps the shell shorts mostly in place and not creeping down during big mountain climbs in Utah. I am using the more durable Gore C5 liner short instead of TLD?s liner (that I bought separately and had quality issues). Lillium shell short in size small fits me great, I am 5?7? 120 lbs. Bought this short in 4 colors and have paired it with the matching Lillium short sleeve jersey (upsizing the jersey to size M). Cute enough to wear off the bike, I been living in these shorts all summer.
review.name: Stylish, comfy and quick drying

name: Lilium Short Shell - Women's

review.reviewBody: FAVORITE JACKET EVER! If there is one halfdays piece I recommend it's THIS. This jacket is consistently grabbed for in my closet with its versatility & the ease I can add or take off the sleeves. Its so warm & the zippers are the highest quality to ensure an easy experience. Love love love buy THIS
review.name: THE BOMB

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] first, we love roomy pockets and this jacket has those which makes it great for hikes when I dont want to carry a whole bag, the sleeves being removable are also a huge plus when I get a little toasty
review.name: so comfy

review.reviewBody: love love loveeee this so much! it's so cute as a vest and a jacket! I would size down :)
review.name: love that its convertible

review.reviewBody: Such a cute jacket that works for all seasons since it is convertible to a vest. I tend to size up in outerwear but it is not necessary with this jacket. I would say it run a bit oversized already!
review.name: perfect for all seasons

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket in my opinion <3 I have it in the baby blue color and I get so many compliments whenever I wear it. The fact that it can transform into a vest is…..genius. Love a multipurpose article of clothing!!
review.name: I love it

review.reviewBody: I bought this in an XS, normally wear a S, thanks to the other reviews, and it was perfect. It fits great despite the fact that I am 5'3" and a lot shorter than the model wearing it. I have only just gotten it, so can't speak to the zipper problem that some apparently have had, but like the style and color [mustang], although am not wild about the two front patch pockets because of the added bulk, and they are just a tad too high when accessed from the top. I do like the fact that the sleeves are removable, though. I think I will get a lot of wear from it as the winters tend to be relatively mild here [Maryland] and it would appear to be about the right weight. It is a little stiff right now, but suspect that will improve with washing.
review.name: Nice jacket, practical with a little flair

review.reviewBody: Great jacket with removable sleeves that make it perfect for spring / fall traveling. Intentionally oversized for a comfy fit, so downsize if you want something a bit more snug. Some reviewers made comments that the zip off sleeves came undone on their own, but I didn’t experience that at all. Big pockets that are lined make this jacket super comfy and practice. Absolutely love it.
review.name: Perfect Spring/Fall Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I really love the idea of this jacket and the fit is great for a pear shape like me. The weight is also great for PNW winter. 

I have two issues, and the first is my main gripe: the sleeves unzip them selves! For me one does it more than the other, but they both gradually unzip, and it's even more drastic if you move your arms around a lot. This could be completely eliminated if there was a clip or something at the end of the zips. This loses two entire stars for me because it's such a major design flaw. Such a shame!

My second more minor issue is the color selection - the colors are cute but it's a really limited palette and the only relatively neutral option that doesn't look awful with my warm olivey skin tone is boring black, which is what I ended up with.
review.name: Almost a great idea...

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I've used it as a vest and jacket, the arms are very easy to remove. I'm usually a medium and went with that, it fits perfect for layering sweaters underneath.
review.name: perfect!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is worth every penny!! What a great gem— it’s got a great weather-proof fabric but it’s not too heavy, and it keeps me so warm!! I love having the zip off sleeves because it’s one less article of clothing to pack in my suitcase. I love oversized things, but I was able to order my regular size because the jacket is (fashionably) boxy and long enough to where i can still layer underneath. I could not recommend this jacket enough!! For reference, I’m 5’8” 125 lb and the small works wonderfully.
review.name: Most amazing jacket!!

name: Davis Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Moji+ Lantern
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Moji+ Lantern online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Went for the plus model for the magnets. Great for car camping/hands free tasks around the car. All set for the next trip!
review.name: Small, fun, and useful

review.reviewBody: I love the magnets! This little, lightweight light can change color and brightness. It can hang in a tent or stick to the side of a bear box at camp. I love the campfire setting which provides a warm, flickering orange light. The batteries last a long long time.
review.name: Small changes, big difference

review.reviewBody: Perfect size to lift up my tent with a very soft, but bright light.
review.name: Perfect for my tent

review.reviewBody: The lantern works great with regular batteries and lasts a really long time. I love the magnets which have solid gripping. The light is perfect for a tent or a camper. It will light up a large room in the dark no problem
review.name: Very handy

review.reviewBody: The variety of lights in this is great. It’s small compact, and the ability to dim is needed is great. If you’re looking for a compact, light weight and effective camp light for your tent this a great choice.
review.name: Great little lantern

review.reviewBody:
I have never been so iluminated in my tent.
Is the perfecto device to glow up the entire tent with 360 degrees of powerfull light
review.name: Say no to dark

review.reviewBody: Very handy little lantern. Very compact, easy to hang using the magnet or the integrated hooks. It has lots of lighting modes and the firelight option is my favorite. We have two of them and use them on all our hut trips and car camps.
review.name: Great little lantern.

review.reviewBody: I love the dual power option on the headlamp and the compact reliability of the lantern. Smart colors.
review.name: Compact and versatile

review.reviewBody: What a smart Lantern. Upon receiving the Mojo in the mail, it just looks like many other ordinary lanterns, but the Mojo is packed with talent. This soft even light is powerful enough for a small room, or above our campsite picnic table. It's ability to dim to a soft night light for any reason is also very impressive. On candle flicker mode or multicolored the kids enjoy setting the mood during different events throughout the year. The ability to use everyday batteries or black diamonds rechargeable batteries is also bonus. From the hardware loops on top to hang the light, the long long light time, to its compact light travel smart size, this lantern delivers!
review.name: Mojo plus Lantern

review.reviewBody: The hooks and magnets on the back work well to attach to various surfaces. I like the size and brightness for what it is, and think it does a good job diffusing the light while still being useable brightness.
review.name: Good size and features

name: Moji+ Lantern

review.reviewBody: Love that a hiking hip belt has it's own hydration bag! It does take up a lot of the capacity when full but the pouch is big enough to hold all sorts of things for a day hike. . . even my outer layer
review.name: Best long hike hip pack

review.reviewBody: This Lagos hip pack holds an entire 2L of water and still has plenty of space for items. I was surprised how much I could put in this pack, even my packable rain jacket fit with the water full and my hiking essentials. Feel comfortable with the padding along the back side. Stays secure and upright. Makes hiking and long walks less cumbersome. Love this!
review.name: looks compact but holds more than my daypack

review.reviewBody: This pack is great! Never carried a bag with a water reservoir before and I’m into it. Ready for some more adventures!
review.name: Lemongrass

review.reviewBody: Bought as a gift for DIL. She is very happy with it.
review.name: Pleased with purshax=se

review.reviewBody: I removed the water holding part and I can fit everything my anxiety-ridden brain needs to function optimially! Dog treats, nail clipper set, lotion, earphones, first aid kit, sewing kit, chapstick, money pouch, card wallet, travel toothbrush and paste, travel size room spray, pocket knife, multi tool. It is the perfect fanny pack- I do home healthcare so I don't have anywhere else to keep my essentials throughout the day.
review.name: Best fanny pack I've ever had

review.reviewBody:
This item is GREAT for rollerblading, offering outstanding support during intense sessions.

It performs beautifully, even when I’m sweating heavily and jumping frequently while skating. 

Plus, the interior space is perfect for storing all my essentials and even more.
review.name: Great Material and perfect for rollerblading!

review.reviewBody: Such a handy little hip pack! Secure and not too bulky, perfect for day hikes. Am definitely excited to use it more!
review.name: Lagos 5L Hiking Hydration Hip Pack

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love this bag. I read the reviews, and even knowing the tube was a little short and misplaced, I bought it on sale. If I cinch up the belt, and only fill the bag with 1L of water, I can get enough tube pulled through for a convenient swig during hikes. I might be able to fill it more if I wear the pack higher than my waist, but I haven’t tried that yet. 
I think it’s worth the money on sale, but it’s not a simple item and could use some reconfiguring. However, I love that it’s magnetic, and I don’t need a second pack for my stuff!
I am 5’10” and 160lb for reference.
review.name: So close to perfect

review.reviewBody: I ordered this pack for my son as a gift. I purchased two last year and love them. The packs are made very nicely and perfect for bike and hiking trips. I love the colors and that they are unique.
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a recent trip but have been using it instead of my purse. Has plenty of space for all your things. I can get my phone, reading glasses, sunglasses. Misc stuff with room to spare
review.name: Great size for everyday use

name: Lagos 5L Hydration Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I bought this for its intended purpose:  Hold water, on a bicycle, when I'm riding the bicycle and also give me the water to drink when I want it.  I've been using it for 10 months or so without fail. I didn't buy it to transport liquids inside of a bag.  Maybe that's why I'm having so much luck with it?  FWIW these bottles are all overpriced but what can ya do?
review.name: It holds water.

review.reviewBody: While there seems to be a fair amount of people pleased with the item, it seems I may have gotten a defective one. I do like the ease of use and simplicity, but today was the 4th time it's leaked all over the inside of my bag. It simply doesn't contain the liquid properly, even when I took special care to tighten it and completely close the valve. The plastic threads just aren't water-tight. Bummer.
review.name: Defective and leaky

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my gf because she kept stealing mine and she loves it !
review.name: Feels Great !

review.reviewBody: I used for normal wear. I got a lot of compliments on the color. Goes nice with blue jeans.
review.name: Yes I would. I have the all black one as well.

review.reviewBody: 30 degrees... I'm not cold, you're cold! Today's high temp barely hit 30°, so what better a day than today to test my new jacket! It was a bit windy with light snow and as long as the jacket was zipped up fairly close to my neck, it did a fantastic job keeping me warm. I didn't even shiver! In fact, I didn't appear to be cold at all. No wind was felt through any parts of the fleece, whatsoever, so it holds up to being wind resistant! I'm really excited and I love it!
review.name: 30 degrees... I'm not cold, you're cold!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is versatile and durable, making it a great addition to any wardrobe. Highly recommend!
review.name: I would buy again this product again

review.reviewBody: Love this! Warm and worth the money. More colors for me

review.reviewBody: These are fantastic glasses. The block out the sun from the sides while i drive.
review.name: Look cool and be comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got these on a warranty claim to replace a previous pair I stepped on. No hassle process and taken care of right away. Love these glasses for skiing and liking above the treeline

review.reviewBody: Excellent black out and comfortable. This was exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Exceeded my Expectations

review.reviewBody: Epic glasses, I am an Wildland firefighter so these really come in handy when using the chain saw. The side blinders help with the wood chips getting into your eyes. Highly recommend them.
review.name: Slaying the Dragon

review.reviewBody: These things are awesome! I got them as a part of the wildland firefighter discount program and they immediately became my favorite sunglasses. I wear them when running a chainsaw and the side flaps help so much to keep from getting chips into my eyes. I am a big fan and I strongly recommend them. Very stylish and well made, and a super cool company I feel really good about supporting!
review.name: Firefighter approved!

review.reviewBody: I love these glasses. I haven’t skied yet with them but I’m certain they will be awesome for it. I hate wearing goggles but then regular sunglasses is just so much wind. I dropped these glasses and the side panels fell off. They so easily snapped RIGHT back in. No damage. Clean. Functional. Durable.
review.name: Cool level 100

review.reviewBody: Good coverage, lightweight, good looking sunnies! The lenses are prone to rattling in their slot.

review.reviewBody: As others have said: a little small for those with large heads, and a little lightweight for the price point.  But the eyeshades are useful for driving LA traffic so I will be keeping them.

hasVariant.name: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
hasVariant.description: Buy the LuminAID PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Straight forward set up and easy to use. I like that the lantern is expandable that way when you are carrying it around you can collapse it to make more space. It has multiple different light modes some of which are surprisingly bright. I can’t speak on the charging speed as I didn’t pay much attention to how long it took to charge. However, I did enjoy its function of acting as a phone charger especially when camping with no electricity since it is solar powered.
review.name: Easy to use and very functional

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this medium sized gadget when there were storms and power outages. It charged my phone all the way, but unfortunately only comes with one usb slot. It is solar powered but also comes with a charger. It is super convenient and operates as a flashlight as well.
review.name: Cool power outage tool

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was actually really impressed with this lantern and its capabilities! Not sure what I expected but this far exceeded my expectations. For one it is much sturdier than I realized! We went camping early this year and unfortunately didn’t get to use this because we didn’t have it yet, however we plan on going at the beginning of September as well & both my daughter and me are happy to have this for our phones and the light it gives off! I will take a photo of it being used in the dark and add that as well. (Didn’t think about this initially). It’s really a great addition for anyone who likes to be outdoors at night or camping. Despite the sturdy build, it’s not heavy at all and can fit right into our backpacks without taking up much room! We just started expanding our camping gear so while others may have these types of things already, we didn’t & are really
Grateful for it!
review.name: Sturdy light & charger!! A+

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This light is insane! It’s so easy to use and so convenient. We use it for s’more making. The only downside is it is so bright that the bugs are attracted to it! It charges so quick in the sun and lasts a long time! We got caught in the down pouring rain and it survived!
review.name: Must have

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don’t think you guys understand how light and small but effective this light box/solar charger is! It’s perfect for any and all outdoor activities or indoor. I just took it with me to the beach solar charged it in the sun then charged my phone and used the light at night for the bonfire. It’s amazing and so convenient. I would recommend this 100%
review.name: Must buy!

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We absolutely love this lantern! It was perfect for our recent camping trip.

Not only was it super easy to pack up and stow, it was very versatile at night - acting as both a flashlight for the trip to the bathroom and we were easily able to hang it from the top of our shelter. It also had the nice side effect of drawing bugs away from us which was great.

We didn’t have a chance to use the solar features but that’s honestly a good thing since it meant that the battery lasted our whole trip! I did charge my phone from it as well so it’s no light weight.

The battery meter was a really nice feature that I appreciated. No guessing game for how much it’s charged before you hit the woods.

Overall I absolutely recommend this lantern and I will honestly check out other products from this brand as well.
review.name: Perfect Camping Lantern

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven’t gotten to actually take this out and use it for an extended period of time but it seems like it will be useful and is a good design . I like how it gets compact and seems like it will be easy to tote around and has different setting for the lights .
review.name: So far so good

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This device is so freaking cool! It doubles as a light and cell phone charger and is perfect for the avid camper. We love a good adventure and this makes it easy to charge our phones and have a flashlight accessible!
review.name: SO COOL

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this!! Never thought I would need something like this, but now I feel prepared for it we lose power during a storm. It’s so cool that it can be charged in the wall or by the sun. It has many different light options, and it’s self inflating. It also can charge your phone! I highly recommend this
review.name: So cool

review.itemreviewed: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great product! I cannot wait to use it on my next hike! The charging speed is crazy fast. The water resistance is perfect for any water activity. I love how portable it is. It fits in anything! The brightness 🔆 was wayyyy more than I could’ve imagined. This is a great product and everyone hiker/camper should have one!
review.name: A MUST BUY💡

name: PackLite Firefly 2-In-1 Power Lantern + Phone Charger

review.reviewBody: Soaked through after a 10 min summer shower. Not cool for the price.
review.name: Wetted out quickly

review.reviewBody: Sadly I’ve had to return the jacket because its fitted shape is too tight over my bust and one size up would be too long in the sleeves. The material feels incredible - really soft and comfortable - and I liked the colour too. I’ve gone with another Rab jacket (same size but different cut) in Gortex which is much crinklier but does fit.
review.name: Sadly I’ve had to return

review.reviewBody:
This is my second Kinetic, and with the exception of summer it gets worn pretty much every day. I only need this one jacket for walking as it does everything.
Despite being thin it still keeps you warm in minus temperatures - just wear the right layers and use common sense. It is not bulky or rustly so it doesn't really feel like you're wearing a coat. 
I'm a fast walker and it has proven to be very breathable. Pit zips would be a bonus, but it is very rare that I miss them. 
Living in Cumbria I can confirm it is definitely windproof and waterproof! The hood is amazing - once up it doesn't move and no rain gets in. It was this that originally made me decide to buy this jacket as I hate having to walk while trying to hold a hood in place. The material is stretchy so there's still room to fit a hat underneath too. 
I am 5ft 8 with a small bust, broad shoulders, wide hips and a long torso. I tend to be a size 14, and that fits perfectly here too and leaves room for layers if you need them. It finishes mid-hip and doesn't need to be constantly pulled down or adjusted. 
An internal pocket would make it absolutely perfect but I appreciate that would compromise some of the other benefits. Overall, this jacket is brilliant! Very happy.
review.name: This is my second Kinetic,

review.reviewBody: Excellent performance. Wish i had bought thosvin beginning, outstanding quality.
review.name: Excellent performance. Wish i had

review.reviewBody: I was a little skeptical that this jacket was going to be waterproof because it's so soft and stretchy, but it didn't disappoint. It doesn't have the plastic bag feeling that most rain jackets do, instead it has a soft next-to-skin feel. I do a lot of active outdoor activities and this jacket is perfect because it moves with you. I mostly use it for day hiking and trail running on those rainy days. Most rain jackets get all clammy on the inside, but this jacket never does. It dries quickly and is very breathable! I was also impressed with how cute the jacket was as well. I sometimes just wear it around town when I just need a light layer to throw on.
review.name: UNREAL Comfy Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Beautiful colour, so glad to see variety in colours in outdoor clothing! The jacket itself is brilliant, it fits great but there is also room for a fleece underneath. It’s really lightweight and packs down small.
review.name: Beautiful jacket

review.reviewBody: Perfect! I will be Able to wear a fleece under the jacket. I love the colour too, it will be cheerful during the winter. The fit was perfect. Thanks very much.
review.name: Perfect! I will be Able

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so versatile. Perfect for running/ hiking/ trekking.
review.name: Perfect for all activities

review.reviewBody: I love my Kinetic 2.0 Waterproof Jacket. It looks good, feels good and keeps me dry. What more could I need!
review.name: I love my Kinetic 2.0

review.reviewBody: Perfect jacket for Spring - very lightweight, super soft and showerproof. Love the colour too.
review.name: Perfect jacket for Spring -

name: Kinetic 2.0 Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought this for downhill skiing in northern Michigan. Very comfortable fit and easy to use hood with good fit for ski helmet. What I like best is the level of insulation (this is insulated version of jacket). Just the right weight for cold mornings  - with long underwear and insulated vest - as well as warmer afternoons. Good looking coat too. And various pockets are very functional.
review.name: Very comfortable and it performs

review.reviewBody: Good jacket for skiing and hiking. Warm and waterproof
review.name: Good Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is a dam good looking jacket. It’s not super big or bulky and it is warm! I’m 5’9 165 and this fit super well. Well made and comfortable too. The only down side is there are only 3 outside pockets (4 of counting small sleeve pocket) and 1 inside picket (2 if you count goggle holder.
review.name: Bang for the buck!

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit! High quality and it looks chic, which is a huge plus.
review.name: Chic looking snow jacket

review.reviewBody: Kept me dry and warm on a rainy ski day in Whistler. Highly recommend, good balance of insulation without being too puffy.
review.name: Tremendous coat

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and functionality. Good looks too. Go to jacket for skiing.
review.name: Mens Firefall/2 Insulated

description: Buy the Katadyn TRK Drip Filter + Ceradyn Element online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: TRK Drip Filter + Ceradyn Element
hasVariant.description: Buy the Katadyn TRK Drip Filter + Ceradyn Element online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It does what its supposed to do. There's nothing else to say. If you need a water filter Katadyn is the brand I pick. I own one of these and two other backpacking filters from them.

A simple straightforward design.  and because of its simplicity its a great design. pour water in from any source and have water to drink ready to go. there's nothing like this on the market and this is great to have as a peace of mind. also good for everyday household use.
review.name: awesome filter

review.reviewBody: I've used one of these for many years in the Alaska bush for work. Thrown them in planes, boats, and cars. I've filtered glacial silk water, heavy tannin water, water with known beaver populations, streams going through the annual algal bloom, salmon spawn water, etc and this thing has remained undefeated. Keep the filters clean and they can last many years. Keep spare filters in case you break them as they are somewhat fragile.
review.name: Used for years

review.reviewBody: I did a lot of research before going with ceramic over a charcoal type filter. The ceramic filter lasts longer and does not need to be replaced if it dries out. I am keeping this for emergencies.
review.name: Good to have for an emergency

review.reviewBody: I've used this model for 5 years now and it's been flawless and if properly kept clean has produced clean flavorless water. Trusted my health with this many times.
review.name: Great Product

name: TRK Drip Filter + Ceradyn Element

description: Buy the WANDRD PRVKE 11 Lite Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PRVKE 11 Lite Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the WANDRD PRVKE 11 Lite Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PRVKE 11 Lite Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the WANDRD PRVKE 11 Lite Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid, sturdy and stylish bags. I have the tan and just received the black. I use them for everything including cameras, personal training and sports officiating equipment. Highly recommend.
review.name: 2nd PRVKE Lite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been looking for a backpack to replace one I have had that was getting worn out. When I travel, I carry my DSLR with a zoom lens, a flash attachment, and spare batteries with charger. I also carry my iPad plus an assortment of charging cords and charger. The Prvke Lite is just the right size - able to fit all items easily as well as have space in the rolltop pocket for a light jacket/fleece. Very comfortable on. Also appreciate the water bottle pocket. If it fits your needs, would definitely recommend. I’m sure that as I use it more in the future that I will figure out even more ways to use the space efficiently.
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: cute, stylish, and functional. i love how light it is, compact, and still holds so much.
review.name: worthy purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ll be honest. I don’t do reviews unless I love the product and as a photographer of over 10 years this is the first bag I can honestly say I love. this isn’t sponsored and I paid for my bag. it’s an honest review. I highly recommend it!
review.name: Fan For Life

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall a solid, compact backpack. Rolltop adds additional storage. A couple of improvements would bring this to 5/5. Instead of magnetized carry handles, have them connect with Velcro. Make the divider between the roll top and main compartment either non removable or bigger - right now some smaller items can fall from the roll top into the main compartment. Make the “passport” pocket a bit larger. Otherwise love the bag.
review.name: solid option for those seeking a compact bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice athletically for around town and rugged enoughfor on the trail. I am a tall, small frame guy and don't like the larger packs so with this pack, I can strap or secure lots of items on the outside of pack when I need those extra items. It has a squarish/blockish feel on your back when fully loaded but you get use it like anything else. The material is holding up well from being on the concrete in city and gravel and rocks out on trail. You won’t be disappointed. Get one.
review.name: Multi-purpose pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the color and the quality of the Lite, but it is underwhelming compared to my full sized PRVKE. It doesn't have the secret side pocket with the key ring holder. Inside the quick access camera spot, there is no zipper storage in that pocket, which I love to use on my full size PRVKE. There is also no secret pocket behind the luggage strap. I also don't think the camera storage is a removable box like in the full size. I suppose that is why it is the Lite version, and perhaps I am biased since I have the original PRVKE and I shouldn't be expecting the exact same thing in a smaller package, but the high price kind of makes me lean towards higher expectations. It is a gift for my best friend and they will be excited to have a quality compact camera backpack so I think three stars is a solid enough review to say: Not bad, but not amazing.
review.name: Leaves you wanting the full size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The PRVKE lite is a perfect size to bring camera gear. Also great to remove camera dividers and use the open space to store items like you would with a day pack. Highly recommended.
review.name: Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've hiked with this backpack twice and so far, I love it! I love the quick access pocket - the reason I bought the bag. The only thing missing is a pocket for a water bladder. I know I can use the laptop pocket in theory, but I'd prefer something separate from the area where my camera sits.
review.name: So far, great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a perfect travel bag when I am trying to go light. Can fit my film cameras, my laptop and even my puffy and still have room for more! Perfect for a plane personal bag under the seat.
review.name: Perfect little bag

name: PRVKE 11 Lite Backpack

review.reviewBody: In Salewa footwear I am delighted to find multiple options of hikers that are not constructed with waterproof "breathable" membrane scheme. That's all marketing. None of which is actually very breathable in the conditions in which we need them to breath. Let's face it, if its that wet on the trail, the water is going to be coming in over the top or wicked in through your socks! Regarding Wildfire, overall fit is very comfortable. The shoe seems to be very breathable which is appealing. The support for a light hiker is good; However in this case because of the fabric construction of the uppers is fairly light-weight the attachment points for the laces tend to apply high pressure on the foot at those specific locations. Other wearers may experience this differently. When compared to the MS Wildfire Edge, which I also recently purchase, the Edge has a stiffer upper with molded gussets that attach the lace tensioning points to the sole and thus more uniformly distribute the clamping force of the laces. The MS Wildfire Edge seems to be a bit less breathable than the Wildfire 2 but likely more water resistance and offers better support in the upper. I also recently purchased the Wildfire Canvas.  This purchase was inspired by the potential breathability of the canvas which seems well suited to my travels in the tropics. The shoe arrived with a lighter insole which, in my opinion, is inadequate. I've since added a stiffer after market insole. The support, or clamping force, of the uppers is less concentrated which I prefer. However, this possibly comes a the cost of a bit less support in the upper. All three models seem to share the same sole. The sole is fairly stiff which I prefer. I'd change nothing about the sole design. The 3 models compared, contrary to my exceptions, I favor the MS Wildfire Edge and Wildfire Canvas (in that order) over the Wildfire 2. I'm hopeful that Salewa will extend this non-membrane architecture to it's hiking boot offerings. Mark Z. Austerlitz, NY
review.name: 3 models compared

review.reviewBody: based on my initial try-on of this shoe im a fan. it is a narrow fit as you would expect from an alpine approach shoe. the toe box is more narrow than my other approach shoes but still reasonable. im a fan of the toe cap rubber, its very tacky. tread pattern looks like a vibram. concerned about all the exposed cordy bits around the heel... looks kinda cool i guess but not sure how that will hold up going through scree fields over time. overall a top notch shoe.
review.name: Diggin em out of the box

review.reviewBody: Decent shoe that fits well. Wore the tread out a little faster than I expected

This shoe has been great. Super comfortable right out of the box and has held up well. I've had many days wearing these with 12k+ steps and my feet don't seem to mind at all. I've worn them in mud and rain and they always clean up easily.
review.name: Super Comfortable

review.reviewBody: These shoes felt a little narrow at first. But after wearing them for a few weeks, I really like them. The lacing system is well suited for a more tailored fit.

My go to shoes for the crag. Great traction and surprising ankle support for a sneaker. The toebox is tight, and the toe tread is good enough for 5.9 if you're confident. Great shoes for doing leads on moderates to setup top-ropes for beginners. Good breathability, feet dried out between multiple creek crossings when wearing synthetic wool blend socks. Since the shoes are stiff comfort on trails is not comparable to softer less precise hiking shoes, there are better options for trail hikers but if you do any amount of scrambling get these! Quality is good enough I will be picking up some Salewa boots once my Solomon Ultra 3s wear out
review.name: Fantastic approach shoes

review.reviewBody: Good boots

Away on vacation, realized I had forgotten my light hiking/approach shoes. Salewa was the only brand the local place had in my size; so I bought a pair out of necessity. Wowzers!  They fit great, tracked perfectly, provide the best support I've experienced and have a terrific undersole. I liked them so much that when I saw a pair of the waterproof model on sale in my size, I grabbed them too.  I don't think much of the innersoles that come with most shoes; but the Salewa innersoles actually perform better than the Superfeet Carbon/Runners I tried.  The "tighter" grommet from around the heel actually WORKS to increase support and prevent your socks from shimmying down into the heel cup. Frankly, I would not get any other brand after enjoying the quality and performance of these shoes.
review.name: From Unfamiliarity to Two Pairs

review.reviewBody:
I have had 3 different pairs of Wildfire approach shoes, these one have held up the best.  I have done over 100 miles this season with a fairly heavy pack on (they show a little wear)

As far as performance, they climb very well.  They are lighter than previous versions and fairly cold.  I prefer the leather Wildfire, I don't think you can get it anymore.

I would buy these again
review.name: Great shoe, holds up better

review.reviewBody: Great approach shoes. Lightweight and comfortable. These are my second pair and I will continue to buy these shoes as they wear out for the foreseeable future.

name: Wildfire 2 Hiking Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Mountainsmith The Sixer 12L Soft Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: The Sixer 12L Soft Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountainsmith The Sixer 12L Soft Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: 20 years ago, I inherited a yellow Mountainsmith cooler. Well, inherited is probably the wrong word. It just showed up at my house and I have no idea where it came from. To be honest, I didn't even know the brand name of it. I just referred to it as my yellow cooler. It soon became my go-to cooler for weekend kayak camping trips as it was one of the few larger coolers that could be shoved into my narrow hatch openings. More than that, ice stayed ice for much longer than in those smaller 6-pack coolers. Eventually, that cooler gave up the ghost and I had to replace it. I looked into all sorts of other coolers. The Yetis are good but they're too rigid and have way too much wasted insulation space that I can't afford in my hatch. So I kept searching...remember...I didn't even know the yellow cooler was a Mountainsmith. But then, searching on Backcountry I saw the anvil logo and it all came back to me. It was a Mountainsmith! Now, I will say that the new version is a tad bulkier and thicker than the old yellow one. But it still stuffs into my hatch pretty easily and keep stuff cold for longer than you'd expect. I love it.
review.name: The cooler Yeti couldn't make

review.reviewBody: It is incredibly well-made and sturdy to hold your drinks! Keeps all the drinks cold for my family and I. Perfect for a group outing! :)
review.name: Fantastic Cooler

review.reviewBody: Sized for that six pack of your favorite microbrew, this cooler can handle all your needs for those end of day sessions.
review.name: Mountainsmith Sixer Cooler

name: The Sixer 12L Soft Cooler

description: Buy the Weston Alpenglow Ski- 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpenglow Ski- 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Alpenglow Ski- 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpenglow Ski- 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Alpenglow Ski- 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Weston Alpenglow skis are an absolute blast. Colorado groomers were perfect for them as the edges gripped really well for carving big, smooth turns, letting me channel my high school ski racer days, ha. They were just as fun for quick, tight turns, making them super versatile.

By midday, when things got chopped up, the rockered nose really came in clutch, keeping the ride smooth and stable. At 6 feet tall and 155 pounds, the 182s felt just right for me, offering a good balance of control and playfulness.

As a backcountry skier, I’m excited to see how they handle touring. While I haven’t taken them out on a backcountry adventure yet, their lightweight design and rockered nose seem ideal for laying a solid uphill track.
review.name: Colorado Groomers and Backcountry

review.reviewBody: This ski is a bit heavier than I would want for a touring ski of its width, personally, (it does come in a bit heavier than advertised, but not enough to complain about) but Holy cow does this thing rip on groomers. The longer turning radius inspires fast, long turns, and while it may not be light enough for touring, it is substantially lighter than the vast majority of resort oriented skis on the market. That inspires playful style in the middle of hard charging lines which is absolutely my happy place.  They are also surprisingly capable when snow gets softer too, due to a surprisingly large early rise in the front end. They don't submarine in soft snow or when you hit a less dense patch of groomer snow. I will be spending a lot more time on these this winter.
review.name: Killer front side ripper

review.reviewBody: I take this ski on my long slogs, my type-3-fun tours.  The narrower waist makes it skin like a nordic ski, smooth and fast.  I like the stiff and skinny skis for steep crusty couloirs which require lots of edging and jump turns.  It’s light and agile but doesn’t sacrifice performance when you push it in mediocre conditions.  I’ve also had a blast carving turns on it during the early season resort groomer days.
review.name: Steep, narrow couloir slayer

name: Alpenglow Ski- 2025

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a riding jacket that would keep me warm and dry when the weather turned, as it can often do (especially up high, here in central Oregon), in the fall.  

I’ve had other brand’s jackets in the past for this use, and either they didn’t breathe well and were bulky and difficult to wear, but sealed out moisture effectively, or breathed really well and were ineffective at keeping me dry.  But even the ones that kept out the external moisture still didn’t keep me dry because of sweat buildup.  Essentially, effective mountain bike rain jackets are a bit of a myth if these are your objectives.  You really can’t have both, IMO.

But then again, who wants to ride in the pouring rain?  Not me, and I love a little bad weather.  The problem is, at least in our climate, when it rains like that the trails hold water and trail spray is far more ingressive than anything except for the worst thunderstorm downpours.

So onto the Cache… sounded like a great concept- mixing panels between weather’proof’ materials and breathable materials. And in pretty much every way except one, this jacket delivered.

Got a chance to test it a couple weeks ago.  Was raining at the trailhead, but the trails weren’t yet sloppy down low.  As we climbed, the jacket performed beautifully- breathed really well (never got hot or built up sweat inside, and shed the light to moderate rain that was falling perfectly.

However as we neared the top, and the rain fell harder and the trails grew soupier, the arms especially started to wet through.  Not terribly, but it was noticeable.

By the end of the ride, after hydroplaning through massive puddles all the way back to the car, the arms were completely soaked.  My shoulders, chest and back were damp too, but not as bad as the arms.

Is this a failure?  Maybe only in my expectations (and the marketing).  You see, I actually think it’s the perfect jacket for me for around here in fall because of my earlier comments.  Who wants to ride in conditions like that?  The ride sucked, frankly.  The failure was going out when we did.

Most of the time, I need a jacket I can wear that breathes, so I actually wear it, but that will protect me should some drops fly.  In that regard this jacket is perfect.  

I own a Patagonia H2No jacket I bought for fishing and on a very wet day on the Missouri River in MT this past June, the thing delivered.  But would I want to wear that jacket mountain biking?  I don’t think so.

After this particular ride I wondered if I’d have been better off with Patagonia’s version of the Cache with the same H2No barrier. And no doubt, at least for the downhill, that jacket would have kept me drier.  But climbing in it wouldn’t have been practical. Likely heavier, less breathable material would have had me all souped up on the inside halfway up the climb.  

So ultimately this is about what you truly need in a jacket.  If you like going out on days that have you returning to the car looking like swamp thing, the Cache isn’t your best option.  

But if you need a functional jacket that is wearable before it rains, and does a pretty good job of protecting you should it rain (lightly to moderately for an hour or less) this jacket is great.
review.name: Weather resistant, not proof…

name: Cache Anorak - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve had it for a month or so and love it. Comfortable, and a nice looking mid-weight winter jacket. Lots of pockets too. One downside I have experienced is that cotton outter shell can make contact with your neck when zipped up and found that it easily wicks your skin oil and the edge of collar looks darker. Like it’s wet. I’ve never had this issue with any other jacket, shirt, etc that I own and I wonder if the wax coating has anything to do with it. It will require frequent collar washings since it happens very quickly. It did for me at least.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Assos MILLE GT Spring Fall LS Jersey - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT Spring Fall LS Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: A superlative spring/fall jersey.  Some reviews complain of the armpits not fitting correctly.  Yes, if you pull the jersey on over a base layer the shoulders will stop at the deltoid because of the thermal layer grabs and the fabric stretches over the shoulder.  After you get it on all you do is pull up on the shoulders to fit the jersey at the arm pits -- no flying squirrel, indeed a perfect fit.  Luxuriously comfortable!  Rode today at 50 degrees, 5-10 mph headwind going out, tailwind on the backside of the loop -- very comfortable into the wind and then with the wind.  It is also very smart looking (torpedo grey).  5' 10", 173 pounds, broad chest/shoulders, size large.  Might could fit a medium, but went large as other Mille jerseys in medium have fit me quite tight.
review.name: Great jersey & it does fit well

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT Spring Fall LS Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I ordered size up thinking it was going to be race fit but it turned out to be true to size. 
The sleeves are to long as well as the arm pits. 

I expected more Quality from Assos.
review.name: True to size

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT Spring Fall LS Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am about 150 lbs, 37? chest, and athletic build. I purchased a medium and It fits perfectly fine.  Assos seems to be going for a form-fitting style, which some folks may not like. However, I love it. It's perfect in the fall.
review.name: Mirror fit

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT Spring Fall LS Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is the first item from Assos that did not fit me well. I have a few other jersey and jackets from them in size M and they fit amazingly when in riding position (they will feel a bit tight in the chest when standing up). The Spring/Fall LS jersey was consistent in terms of arm, body, neck, but the fit under the armpits was really weird and very uncomfortable... it felt a bit like I was wearing a flying squirrel suit.

Also... the front material was also a lot shinier than I expected... it's not a 'matte' finish.
review.name: Odd fit - not like other Assos gear
comment:
I've found one needs to hike the sleeves up higher up your shoulder/traps to bring the material in on the armpit to avoid the squirrel suit feel.  

This is especially true if you are sizing down (based on their height chart), or if you have larger than 'normal' trapezius muscles.  This makes for shorter sleeves, though I believe the cut on the mille are designed this way (and frankly most of their non-aero jerseys).  It's a little odd to do, but only takes a second and makes for a great fit that makes seams of the jersey line up appropriately around your arm.
I'd have to agree the fit in armpits doesn't feel right

name: MILLE GT Spring Fall LS Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: The bottom of the shoe is very good: it is soft and cofortable but the strap is uncomfortable and overdesigned.
review.name: Hut Ultra Wrap

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, great arch support.  Wear everywhere. Size 8 was great for my 7 1/2 foot. Bought a second pair.
review.name: Comfy and great support
comment: Thank you for your awesome support!

review.reviewBody: These are perfect recovery slides! They cushion your foot and the straps can be tightened to hold them on your feet better! If you have plantar fasciitis, you’ll appreciate these slides since they protect your arch and cushion your entire foot! I hike a lot and slip into these after and I feel like I’m walking on marshmallows with no heel pain! Also, easy to clean since they are a water proof foam type material. Obviously not foam but something similar and the dirt wipes off easily. I bought the white and they cleaned up nicely! I had to buy another pair for my hiking partner to keep her feet in good shape! I’m hoping to buy a third pair to use around the house!
review.name: ARCH SUPPORT!

review.reviewBody: Supportive footbed, like that they're adjustable, but they make my feet sweat like crazy
review.name: Ehhhh

review.reviewBody: Surprised a bit that it took me awhile to break in before they became comfortable. Satisfied with purchase, no real surprises based on description and other reviews. Not sure how long they will last, they appear to be well made. Purchased as a less expensive option to Birkenstocks. When these wear out I will probably shop alternatives.
review.name: Good, not great for me.

review.reviewBody: I  got the Hut Ultra Wrap to replace a pair of Cr*c Slides that had worn down after several years. The Ultra Wraps are not as comfortable as the Cr*c Wrap Slides. Perhaps they will break in over time but the clip strap seems to be redundant and it's difficult to find the balance of snug fit vs comfort.
review.name: Merrell vs Crocs

review.reviewBody: Love These Ultra Hut Wrap (Highrise) they have fleece lining! I was surprised with since I ordered for the light blue color & off white(grey) . The soles are so cushioning & comfy! 💜
review.name: Adjustable straps are a big plus for adjusting wid
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: One the most comfortable sandal ever. Love these. Travel everywhere with them. Great arch support as well helps with the lower back. Definitely recommend these.
review.name: Greatness was made with these sandals

review.reviewBody: The hut ultra wraps are very comfortable and lightweight. I have pretty sensitive feet and require a high amount of cushion in my shoes. I have tried similar products from other brands and I feel that these ultra wraps meet my needs in not only comfort but are also made to last. The best feature is the adjustable straps that allows you to customize the fit for your feet.
review.name: Next level cushion
comment: Thank you for the awesome review!

review.reviewBody: Really like the Ultra Wraps. They do not fall off or give you the sensation they are going to come off. Excellent fit and comfortable.
review.name: Comfy

name: Hut Ultra Wrap Sandal - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Comfort Plus SI Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My original mat I bought from you guys had issues with leaking through the foam mat part. I was very happy you replaced it free and the new one works great.
review.name: Leaking mat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Top notch kit as expected from sts. I'm a larger ape so the only gripe would be the width and the pack size(everyone wants pack size reduced but you can't argue with physics). Well done with this product.
review.name: Solid kit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the best low profile sleeping pad I have used so far. I have tried several cheaper pads but they don't last and are not as comfortable as the this one. I have only used it about 5 times but it seems to be holding up nicely.
review.name: Great sleeping pad!

review.reviewBody: About to order two more so the kids don't wake either other up rolling around all night on traditional air mattresses!
review.name: Awesome mattress!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable sleeping pad that now comes in a great compression stuff sack for easier packing. Super impressed with the compay support provided for the product as well.
review.name: Super happy

review.reviewBody: We did a test night with this where it worked great. Went on a 10 day trip and on night one it no longer wants to stay filled. End up basically sleeping directly on the ground.  It much. Very disappointing and a sore back to go along with it.
review.name: Looks great, falls flat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We ordered the double wide sleeping mat. It is amazing. Lightweight and compact. Super comfortable. Even when im sleeping on my side my hip doesn't touch the ground. Love that it has the foam. The self inflating feature is really handy, and o love how easy it is to tip it off with more air.
review.name: Amazing!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice, thick pad. I really enjoy how quiet the fabric is, as I’m usually bothered by crinkly pads. As with any “self-inflating” pad, you’ll have to help it out to get the desired firmness, but the one way valve makes it super easy and helps in fine-tuning as well. Overall I’d recommend this pad to anyone who is looking for a warm, quiet sleeping pad.
review.name: Great Pad!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very comfortable pad and for my use it was excellent in insulating me from the ground. I only had 2 issues with it. Number 1 was it did not fully inflate to the 3 inch thickness without some air pump assistance. Number 2 was it is difficult to roll up every morning when packing up. Lumpy ground doesn't help and inside the tent folding the pad length-wise takes some effort. I finally just rolled it up in a 25 in roll and fastened it outside my pack.
review.name: Comfy Pad

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is core to my river trips or sleeping in my 4Runner. I either put a small tarp underneath or on my cot when on the ground.

Self inflates fast. Comfortable and I dig the bag it comes in.

Takes a little time to roll up in the morning but completely worth it for how fast it sets up and is so compact.

You need to keep it uncompressed when storing so be sure to have a place for it. Mine fits in the back of my closet landscape.

Biggest pro: My original one fell victim to a sharp piece of metal when I was moving. Warranty kicked in and with no complaints S2S staff reached out (even talked to me on the phone) and replaced it fast - complete with shipping label for return. 

Way to go S2S!
review.name: Awesome, my go to for river trips

name: Comfort Plus SI Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.name: Legacy 6in Insulated Lace Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Xtratuf Legacy 6in Insulated Lace Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These run one full size smaller than your typical shoe size. Sucks to be size 11, I guess.
review.name: Full Size Smaller

review.reviewBody: Bought two pairs of these for my wife and her best friend who are coming Alaskan Coho fishing with me in September.    They each wear a size 9 women's, but size 10 in these boots.   Make room for extra heavy socks.
review.name: Great boot and she liked the way they fit!

review.reviewBody: I like the boots,they fit well but more insulation or better. My feet got cold yesterday at 16*.
review.name: Insulated boots
comment:
Heather,
Thank you for the positive review! Thanks for the support!

review.reviewBody: Daily wear for the last 3 months, comfortable and warm. I ordered an 8, and I usually wear a 7.5. Fit was perfect. Hasn’t shown any signs of wear yet.
review.name: What I’d expect from Xtratuf

review.reviewBody: I live in Revelstoke, BC where we get a lot of snow and wet weather, but the temperature can occassionally dip to -20C. I have found these boots to be great for addressing all kids of weather, and I like the relatively tight upper for keeping snow out.
review.name: Great for cold and wet winters.

review.reviewBody: Sizing was way smaller than actual size. I ordered a 9 (I wear 8-8.5) the boots fit lit a 7-7.5 and I don't think the quality is as good as their other boots. I wouldnt recommend them. Or if you need them, make sure you get 1.5-2 sizes bigger.
review.name: LEGACY

review.reviewBody: I lived in the Pacific Northwest of USA for years, and am a big fan of Xtratuf classic boots. I just moved to Atlantic Canada, and purchased these for wet, icy, snowy winters. They are amazing. Warm, comfortable, consistent with Xtratuf sizing. (I'm an 8.0-8.5 in regular shoes, and bought a 9.0. It is the perfect size with wool socks.) They're heavier and wider than some winter boots, but this gives them the usefulness and durability for standing up to the weather. Highly recommend.
review.name: Outstanding boots.
comment: Hello Siobhan and thank you for providing us with your review. We are happy to hear you are satisfied with the boots you purchased, and we hope you continue to be an Xtratuf supporter!

name: Legacy 6in Insulated Lace Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Vans Slip-On Shoes: A Must-Have for Everyday Comfort

I’ve been rocking the Vans Slip-On shoes for both gym sessions and work, At the Gym:
These shoes are surprisingly versatile. While they’re not typical gym shoes, they hold up well for light workouts or weightlifting. The flat sole offers great stability, especially for exercises like squats or deadlifts. 
If you’re looking for shoes that combine style, comfort, and practicality, Vans Slip-Ons are the way to go. They transition seamlessly from gym to work without missing a beat. Highly recommended!

⭐ Rating: 5/5
review.name: Gym Shoes

review.reviewBody: Perfect and comfy as always great fit even with a wide toe box, will go well with the rest of my slip on collection.
review.name: perfect as always

review.reviewBody: Great looking, fir well & really like the red vans label on the heel
review.name: Great looking

review.reviewBody: I bought these as a Christmas gift as the wearer really like them and needed a new pair. This will be her third pair.
review.name: Repurchase

review.reviewBody: Iconic for a reason! Have loved these for an and finally decided to try them and absolutely love them. The slip on style is also very comfortable. I chose my usual Vans size and have to say it’s perfect.
review.name: Vans Slip on

review.reviewBody: I can’t stop wearing them ! They go with everything! These shoes are my favourite ones!
review.name: Great and comfortable everyday shoes

review.reviewBody: Very good wear inside and out winter and summer three pairs now lucky me as hard to buy, rough and ready also best dressed.
review.name: Cool and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Because they are quite narrow I had to go a size up. This just means I scrape the toes sometimes because they a bit long for my feet. Otherwise they are super comfy.
review.name: Narrow but comfy.

review.reviewBody: I wore out my my black vans after a number of years.  Couldn't do without them so I replaced them.
review.name: Love my black vans.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Kuat NV Base 2.0 Bike Hitch Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Do yourself a favor and buy a 1up rack!  The just base has no structural integrity.  Ours collapsed in on itself at the base.  The assembly is a royal pain in the butter.  There is to many pieces held together by screws only.  It is fine for road bikes and mild highway use but nothing more!  I will never get another Kuat!
review.name: Very poorly designed

review.reviewBody: Purchased this rack after buying two e-bikes that weigh about 50 lbs each and our old rack wouldn't support them. Recommend watching the assembly video on YouTube, makes the assembly process easier.  Very sturdy and easy to use once attached to car.  Love that I can still access the back of the vehicle.  Ramp extension helpful if alone and putting heavy bike on the rack.  With two people, easy to lift the bikes on and off without the ramp.  Overall excellent product.
review.name: Excellent hitch rack for heavy e-bikes

review.reviewBody:
I've been wanting to get a hitch-mount bike rack for years and finally picked this one up prior to a trip where we wanted to be able to ride some nature trails. The build quality of this rack is very nice, and the price is really reasonable compared to other racks on the market. The trip was a 4+ hour drive away from home and despite my initial concerns due to never having used it before, the Kuat  NV Base 2.0 rack held tight onto our bikes. I checked them at each of the 3 stops we made along the way to make sure the bikes hadn't jostled loose and to my relief neither the front nor back attachments had moved at all. Both bikes stayed stayed put without any trouble for the whole trip. 

Another reviewer commented that their 43mm tires were too small for this rack on their gravel bikes, but I was hauling two 2021/3 Trek Domane AL's with 40mm tires and had no issues. I don't know what was different with my setup, but I found the rack perfectly suitable for smaller tires. I haven't tried to use the rack with a bike running road tires, but the front attachment seems to be able to handle it just fine.

There are built in cable locks for the bikes to act as a basic theft deterrent, but they have some caveats. Cable locks are fairly trivial to cut through, but as a basic deterrent they work ok. One thing I struggled with was that  I couldn't figure out a way to lock the bike with the built-in lock without the possibility of the lock banging against a critical component (brake rotor or derailleur). I ended up just unlocking the bikes while on the road, but it would've been nice to be able to keep them locked for the whole trip. It'd also be nice if there was a hard point where you could lock a more substantial lock (such as a heavy duty chain/lock combo) to keep the bikes safe when unattended for longer periods. 

Pros: 
Super secure bike attachment, even at 70+ mph
I prefer the color to either of the non-Base options 
You can add-on a trail doc, but if you don't need/want it, you don't have to pay for it
The hitch attachment is super secure and never budged
Built in locks are good for basic theft deterrent.
Customer service was quick and helpful
Can be expanded by 1 or 2 additional bikes if needed with additional purchase

Cons:
Somewhat expensive, although cheaper than many other options
Locks are a bit awkward to use and could damage bike during transit
review.name: Solid hitch-mount bike rack

review.reviewBody:
Compared to my previous bike rack, the Kuat NV Base 2.0 fufills all my MTB transporting needs.  Its quality built, definitely sturdy and is very functional.  Despite what other may say about assembly, I didn't have any issues with it.  The feature I especially like is how the rack is secured via ball bearing.  That feature wasn't available with my previous bike rack which was nerve-wracking when transporting my e-MTB.  

The tilt up and down feature works smoothly and doesn't get hung up in movement.  The pivot lever for hand or foot use is also a nice touch.  Overall, I don't regret purchasing this rack and give it a 5-star rating.
review.name: No Regrets with the Kuat NV Base 2.0!

review.reviewBody: I think that rack would be OK for a MTB or Fat tire, but my gravel bike tires are simply too narrow at 43cm and the clamp on the arm does not tighten down nearly tight enough to hold the bike upright and steady (with confidence).  I've got a 1up rack and it is FAR superior to this thing.  The cost of this rack does not support its design...
review.name: Not a fan

review.reviewBody:
The Kuat NV Base 2.0 Bike Hitch Rack is excellent.  I was very impressed with the quality and ease of use.

I have had racks where you had to shim the receiver so the rack did not bounce around.  Kuat has a knob that you can turn that moves a ball bearing and tightens the rack in the receiver.

My only suggestion would be the addition of a rubber piece where the back tire is on the platform. I used studded tires in the winter on my Fat bike and 29" MTB and the studs will destroy the surface finish. 

Otherwise, I wish the description on the Backcountry site was a little better between the NV Base and NV.  After the purchase, I noticed the bike stand option.  It appeared the only difference was the finish. My mistake for not doing more research.
review.name: This is an excellent bike rack

review.reviewBody: Surprised how easy it is to move up and down and it's very study. I'm very happy with this rack after a month and a long road trip.
review.name: Very sturdy and easy to maneuver

review.reviewBody: This is a really nice rack. It comes with everything you needed for assemble, tools and all. It's really simple to put together. I didn't even need the instructions. Looks great and is exactly what I need. Functionally it operates really smooth with a precise feeling when actuated. I like it!
review.name: NV Base 2.0 Bike Hitch Rack

review.reviewBody: I've owned this tack for about 4 trouble free years with only one complaint really. iTS HEAVY.  Stupid heavy.  I've seen many people complain about the extending lever that locks on to the front tire rubbing against the bike.  These people are likely placing the rubberized or plastic hook against the fork.  This is not correct.  Place the hook a inch or two away from the fork and press is down hard onto the tire.  The bike remains secure and the rack is no where near to touching the bike or fork.
review.name: Heavy as hell

review.reviewBody: I'm very much impressed with the quality of the build of this rack, it is very  strong  and  sturdy, although, is a bit heavy and hard to load the bikes  by myself. When watching the video, it shows that the rack swings to the side which was the major reason I purchased it to begin with. I hope that there is an adapter for this rack so it can perform both functions.
review.name: Heavy duty  bike rack

name: NV Base 2.0 Bike Hitch Rack
