hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Equipment Gangotri Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Clothes shopping online: can't try 'em on, so it takes caution and care.  Certain makers stand above the average, and it paid off to order this MH Gangotri jacket.  Importantly, it's fleece is the respectable Polartec Thermal Pro stuff (good weave, performance, and "feel" to it), which has a bit more than medium thickness, so it feels warm w/o stiffness, promising long wear.  It's proportions are good: I got an L, which is OK alone, but big enough to layer atop 2 shirts; the arm and tail lengths are generous, and the collar, made with two thicknesses of fleece, stands high enough for some neck warmth.  

The zippers are strong, not undersized or weak like others, and include pull cords/tabs.  The hand pockets are roomy, and set above the waist, so don't create a bottom-edge bulge.   The inner phone pocket is roomy and secure.  There's a webbed front inner lining.  The jacket bottom edge is wrapped and elasticized, and it's wrapping carries up the front zipper to the top of the collar, features which both help keep wind out.  Stitching details are perfect; tight, regular lines and curves, and complete, not even a hanging thread anywhere.   Altogether, the styling, materials, and construction sum up to a good-looking and versatile jacket.
review.name: Mountain Hardware/MH hits the mark here.

review.reviewBody: Super quality heavyweight fleece. Runs small however so I had to send it back. Larger size unavailable.
review.name: Super nice fleece, runs small

name: Gangotri Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Absolutely my favorites for everyday in warmer weather.
review.name: Big Kids Newport H2

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit perfectly and since day one could walk forever with total comfort!
review.name: Most comfy shoes!,

review.reviewBody: These are the only shoes my daughter will wear! She loves them. They are comfy and cute.
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: I have about 30 pairs of keen fit is ok .The color is a little brighter than I anticipated so I was a little disappointed with that everything else is fine.
review.name: Keen Newport

review.reviewBody: These shoes seemed tighter than my prior Newport H2 pairs. I think the strap is a little shorter than earlier pairs I have. I’m able to wear comfortably without socks so still worth keeping but I’d like to inquire about this for future purchases.
review.name: Ok but not a fave

review.reviewBody: Easy to slip on and loose enough to not trigger my 5 year olds OCD yuck impulse. Great for the water park or jungle gym. Easy for her to run in while providing better support than flip-flops.
review.name: Protect little toes

review.reviewBody: My 8yr. Old grandson has been wearing these for 6 yrs now. He loves them.
review.name: Buy every summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great shoes- I buy them every summer for my two kids and they never fail.
review.name: Great shoes as usual

review.reviewBody:
I am a TTS women’s 7 size with fairly wide (and flat) feet. I couldn’t resist this new pattern and I am so glad I got it, along with purchasing a new pair for my toddler. I got a big kids 5 size, and it is ever so slightly snug, but I am okay with that. If I had gotten a big kids size 6, I’m afraid that would be too big, and I’m not a big fan of having too much space between the top of the shoes and my toes. Also, for a wide feet gal, it is a big tight on the bottom half of my feet (near my heel area). The toes are fine, but I feel like it’s just a little tight towards the bottom half end of my heels area, even though I’ve stretched the bungee lace. Lastly, I do have to mention that the Velcro is short— both in small/toddler and big kids shoes! I barely can out the strap on the tip of the Velcro because my feet-ankle is big 😬, but I’ve noticed that it’s short on my toddler’s as well. 

Keen— please expand your Velcro and straps!!
review.name: Great!

name: Newport H2 Sandal - Kids'

review.reviewBody: I had an Evoc multi frame bag for 2 years, and the zipper broke. It never opened easily the whole time I had it. Got an Adipura race frame bag to replace it. The bag wasn't bad, but the zipper didn't open widely enough to fit items for my liking. Enter this frame bag. It was a little longer than I wanted, but the entire bag is obscured by my frame's top tube, and knee rub isn't an issue. The bag itself is reinforced at the edges, and the material seems very durable. I am very satisfied with the dimensions, as it fits the accessories I want to take for my rides. The zipper is easy to reach, and has one on both sides for convenience. You can't go wrong with this bag!!
review.name: Best frame bag yet

review.reviewBody: Fits will on my gravel bike, will be a nice addition for storing snacks and small items on my rides.  Like this much better than a top tube 'bento' style bag.

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They came though with flying colors when tested over big rocks (made it easier), streams and muddy areas (kept me dry).  They supported my ankles well which is what I was looking for.  I'm so glad I got them!  Hopefully, they will last me a long time.  I normally wear 7 but got 7.5 which fit me well.
review.name: So far, so good

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for hiking in the National Parks out West! Best purchase ever! Comfortable and supportive right out of the box!! So so very happy with my purchase!! I want to get the low version now for day hikes!
review.name: Best boots ever!

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I tried several hiking boots and shoes, and this boot was by far the most comfortable. Lots of cushion. Sized up 1/2 size. Good fit. Unfortunately, the high ankle support bothered me. I ended up going with a Salomon mid, although I will need to buy inserts to add comfort.
review.name: Soooo Comfortable, but Still Returned…

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bouncy on the paved roads. Well-made! Wish there were kids size. Other reviews said they ran small; actually they are true to size. But I don’t regret buying half size up.
review.name: Light as comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I am extremely happy with this boot! I had never tried a pair of La Sportivas and knew nothing of the brand's reputation (I've had Solomons that lasted five years, and bought Keens and Merril before that), but this boot had all the features I need in the AZ desert--good tread with a straight edge, no mesh, and light color (it's actually tan, not cantaloupe colored as it appears on the screen). With Backcountry's fast shipping, and excellent return policy, I felt brave enough to order them without ever trying on something made by this brand.
They were comfortable right out of the box--stiff enough to need a little break-in by just wearing around the house and yard for a day, but not so stiff it was a problem. Lightweight--the structure is thin, relative to other boots I've bought, but extremely sturdy and seemingly durable. They also kept my feet dry while tromping through a meadow that soaked my pant legs, but don't make my feet sweat. 
My only two complaints are that they came up as an option when I filtered for or searched for "wide" boots, and they're not; the European sizing should have clued me in. I have yet to wear them on a strenuous hiking trip, so we'll see if that's a problem, but so far it hasn't been. The other "issue" I have (it's more of a personal quirk than an actual problem) is with the top two grommets; they have a small gap in the middle that you have to squeeze the laces between before pulling them tight, instead of the usual "hook from behind" style, but it's really not a show-stopper. If you HATE that style of grommet, don't get these, but if you're looking for a great boot, don't let it stop you from purchasing them!
Thanks, Backcountry! My feet are very happy.
review.name: Best boot in a long time

review.itemreviewed: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable and light weight comparing to my other hiking shoes. The ankle support! I can’t wait to try them out on the trail. The structure is really amazing. For the size I used the chart and it was perfect. If you’re a new to hiking you need to know for hiking shoes you need a half size bigger than your everyday walking shoes; room for downhill.. I’m a 8 1/2 in my regular shoes so I get a 9 in my hiking shoes US so got 40.5.
review.name: Amazing

name: Nucleo High II GTX Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Great water bottle. 
Best advantage. Never spillls even if you knock it over. Have used this particular model for years. Love it!
review.name: Great water bottle. Best advantage.

review.reviewBody: Bottle water dispense system is perfect, locking and unlocking flow, perfect as well. The only complaint I have is in reference to the color. It looks metallic on the image, but in reality is pretty dull, I was not everything is perfect on the internet! Will recommend 100%
review.name: Podium bottle, color: Purple

review.reviewBody:
The bottle is fine, the top... just... who designed this? Did you actually *use* it after you designed it? The bottle holds liquid as long as you rotate the nozzle to closed. If you leave the nozzle in the open position, it leaks. It does it on my mountain bike and my road bike on smooth pavement. The solution is to leave the nozzle in the closed position but then the nozzle is so hard to operate, you have to stop the bike, open the nozzle, take a drink, close the nozzle, put the bottle back in the holder and take off again.

I get that level of functionality out of a bottle at half the price so I'll be going to cheap bottles.

The design on this new nozzle is nothing short of atrocious. I guess form over function is the name of the game.
review.name: Please Go Back to Previous Top

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these shoes, and they destroyed my heels. I had an older pair of the exact same size that I loved, but Scarpa removed some of the heel padding. This left a very rigid area in the back that with even the tiniest amount of movement will rub your heels raw. To make matters worse, when I tried to return these shoes, Scarpa wouldn't let me because they were "used". Don't bother purchasing unless you are completely positive these will work for you out of the box.

description: Buy the Black Diamond Highline Stretch Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Highline Stretch Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: Highline Stretch Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Highline Stretch Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
After over 8 years of reliable performance, my trusty Marmot pants started losing their waterproof capabilities, so I decided to upgrade to the Highline Stretch Pants in January 2024, along with the Dawn Patrol Jacket. Initially, I was very impressed with the pants during the winter season—they seemed well-designed and functional.

However, when I resumed using them in November 2024, I was disappointed to find that the pants had already lost their waterproofing ability. To make matters worse, the snap on the left pant leg broke off, further diminishing their usability.

I reached out to Black Diamond customer service, hoping for a quick resolution. Unfortunately, their response was underwhelming. They suggested I send the pants in at my own expense, with an evaluation time of 3 to 5 weeks to determine if anything could be done. While this policy isn’t entirely unreasonable, it falls short of the high standards set by other outdoor brands. In my experience, issues like this are typically resolved within days—not weeks.

Based on this experience, I can’t recommend the Highline Pants or Black Diamond. While the initial quality seemed promising, the durability and lackluster customer support leave much to be desired. There are more reliable options available in today’s competitive outdoor gear market.
review.name: Disappointing Durability and Support

review.reviewBody: Luv these. I'm 5'8, 160 - the medium is right on. Finally got these pants to match my BD Highline jacket. Now, feel ready when out and about with this packable combination.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: I wore these for 22 miles of trekking in windy snow and wet fields. They were great! kept me dry and fought off the wind. The fit was great. Not baggy, but I could easily climb over and under deadfall on the trails. I also bushwacked through briars and they didn't snag or tear. One day 2 (14 miles) the waist began to get a little loose so they sagged a bit. Adding a cinch or more elastic may help.
review.name: Comfortable and weatherproof

name: Highline Stretch Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very tight in toebox.  Even though it is supposedly a wide fit, it is narrower than my 6 year old Shimano TR32 shoes.
review.name: Narrow - Does not fit like a Wide Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have a slightly wide right foot most cycling shoes are too narrow. The regular width versions of these are too narrow. These fit perfectly, and are stiff enough for  all my cycling needs.
review.name: Perfect fit and stiffness

review.reviewBody: Shimano used to make excellent wide cycling shoes. Then they changed their lasts and now the normal shoe is narrow (B or C) and the wide shoe is normal (D) and there is no EE or 2EE shoe.  I wish I had bought a 2nd pair 10 years ago.
review.name: Definitely not wide

review.reviewBody:
Well made shoes. The length pretty much matches Sidi and specialized. The problem with these is that they aren’t that wide. They are almost slightly wider than a normal cycling  shoe. The specialized torch 3 s-works, vented,  feels wider but that might be due to the vented fabric at the balls of your foot. Regardless, as my foot expands while riding, I’d feel pressure build up at the sides for sure with these shimanos. 

The cycling industry has to do a better job with standardization of shoe sizing at the very least specifying shoe sizes better because 42 wide doesn’t cut it. The first company that does that will most certainly get all the sales. Online sales will surely force them in this direction. Until then the search continues.
review.name: Nice shoes but not that wide.

review.reviewBody: Bought these Shimano RC702 as a second pair of road cycling shoes, Great Fit and Finish 41 wide, Love the double boa does hold my feet in place real secure! I've taken some suggestions on replacing the footbeds with better more comfortable one and what a difference those new footbeds do to an already great cycling shoe!! Also the heel is carbon so no flexing at all!!
review.name: Great Cycling Shoes

name: RC702 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Boots are great. Process on Backcountry.com was the best I could find between in-store pricing and online pricing. Very pleased with the overall purchase and boots.
review.name: Awesome Boots

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought 2 pairs of these boots for my husband. He needed new ones and loved the first pair so I instantly bought the second for back up and just nice evenings out. The first pair ended up smelling like cat pee after a month and we DO NOT OWN ANY ANIMALS! He soaked them with vinegar and it didn't work then used Danner boot cleaners and it didn't work then soaked in laundry soap (just the sole) in the bathtub over night and it didn't work. They stink so bad that he can't wear them at work or even public bc of the smell. He then started using his other pair and it's been a little over a month and the smell started again! It's like once you hit the second month your doomed! So disappointing bc they look great and he loves them and super comfortable after the break in process by now they are useless! I can't recommend these solely bc it happened to both pairs not just one! Good luck!
review.name: Boots Smell Like Cat Pee

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots knowing that they are a light duty boot but I figured they could take at least the beating of being on a roof.. But  My feet being a different angles in the boot did not work out too well.. I've had the boots now for 8 months  But have only worked in them for about 5 and the upper stitching has blown out!   The toe is gone.. Are you trying to make a boot that's just fashionable or a boot for work.. I'm not very impressed!
review.name: Disappointed
comment: This is NOT a work boot this is a everyday casual boot I own 5 pair of these and 1 pair of the lux version along with some red wing Thursday and thorogood and the dancers are by far the most comfortable and have held up better than all the others and I?m not light on them either but I also do t try to put the boot through what it?s not intended for either. So of course this boot will start to break down when you use them for something they are not intended for. That would be like me taking my spyderco dragonfly knife and trying to pry with it instead of using my Medford, strider, hinderer, or Chris reeve knives it?s basic common sense if you wanted to work in these then you need to get the safety toe version they will be built definitely and be reenforced in areas that are more susceptible to hard use.

name: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: A very functional fleece jacket. It's warmer than you might expect from "Abisko Lite" collection. I use it all year around, also in winter months in Alps when trekking. I live the pockets with zip, also the chest pocket. Runs a bit large, I usually wear M, but bought this jacket in S and it's still quite wide (I'm, 175 cm tall, 62 kg). Love the long sleeves, specially on colder days I pull them down and use thumb hole. The only flaw in my opinion: the fabric is not very stretchy, so you cannot pull the sleeves up when it gets warmer (I'm so used doing it when hiking).
review.name: Warm and functional fleece

review.reviewBody: I loved it, except……I’m tall and if you added about an inch of length to the overall item, it would have been perfect. The sleeves are plenty long - which is usually a problem for me - but the overall length was too short. Another thing that would be nice is “ princess seams” so it seems more fitted and less boxy. I love the new colors, but until it’s longer overall, I just can’t buy it. Btw, I’m 5’10” and about 185 lbs (sorry, don’t know the kg conversion).
review.name: Love it…..but…..

review.reviewBody: I straight up love this jacket.  Fits nice and snug - I sized down and it's exactly what I was looking for from a sizing perspective.  It's warm, non-fuzzy fleece.  The pockets are nice and the thumb holes are a great addition.  Would absolutely recommend.
review.name: Favorite Jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect in all ways. For my broad shoulders, fairly long arms,  slim torso, the fit is spot on. Considering the numerous different fleece jackets I have tried on and own, this is saying something. It is a nice light weight for hiking in the Spring or for layering under a jacket in the Winter. Of course, it is great for casual wear as well. The Terracotta Brown and Dune Beige are refreshing colors. I aim to enjoy these for many years to come!
review.name: Excellent light jacket!

review.reviewBody: Purchased this jacket to wear during flight training; which is in a close-quarters cockpit that gets cold in winter and hot in summer. Need it to be able to bend and flex during pre-flight checks, to handle damp & drizzle in New England, but look nice enough to wear under a blazer for lunch or professional mingling. Did all of these beautifully. The pockets are in the perfect place, the thumbholes help to keep it in place if I use it as a layer under heavier fleece, the colors are lovely. and the cut and fit is true to size. Stands up to washing, oil stains, sweat, and everything I've thrown at it in the aviation environment. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great Spring Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is a well-made piece and feels like it would last.  However, the sleeves are super long.  They hang 3-4 inches past my longest finger, and my arms are a normal length.  The fox is super tiny and hidden on the sleeve.  It’s a nice layering piece, but the sleeve length was a dealbreaker for me.
review.name: Well made

name: Abisko Lite Fleece Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: the booties are warm and comfortable. I have worn them around the house and some outdoor. i got these for easy slip on during the winter for going to the gym so my shoes stay dry. they aren't the easiest to slip on. I wear an 11 and the M when I have socks on feel a bit tight.
review.name: warm n comfy but a couple issues

review.reviewBody: Super warm and comfortable! The bottoms of them are quite grippy. They are a bit on the heavier side if you are planning to take them backpacking.
review.name: Warm!

review.reviewBody: These booties are perfect for running outside to grab more firewood.  They are also great for walking around first thing in the morning, before I have a fire going.  The sole is nice and sturdy.  They are perfect for my cabin in Minnesota.
review.name: perfect for winter chores

review.reviewBody: Went with size XL and glad I did. These big black booties are a thing of beauty. Suuuuper warm & comfy. Like all-terrain sleeping bags for your feet. One of my favorite practical items. After a long day in hiking boots, your feet will thank you.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: Great product light to carry and so comfortable after a long hike worth every penny
review.name: Light and warm

review.reviewBody: Easy-on-easy-off, quick don boots if you have to run out in the snow real quick while camping or at home, or just to keep your feet warm around the house. Comfortable fit; not too tight but still stable on uneven footing. Sole is tough enough that I am not worried about rolling over rocks or rough terrain. Cool design and pattern, as well.
review.name: Warm, good fit, and solid footing.

review.reviewBody: Easy on when having to run outside in the snow real quick. Also great for around the campsite when it's cold.
review.name: Warm feet...

review.reviewBody: Taken these out on two overnight snowshoe trips, and they do an exceptional job keeping the feat warm. I love how the bottoms are quite durable for walking in the snow.
review.name: Fantastic trax booties

review.reviewBody: Great rugged booties. Model with tracks so no more slipping. I recommend this product for all humans with snowy winters.
review.name: As comfortable as your grandma's soupe can get you to be

review.reviewBody: Ok maybe this is 'off spec' but these are my new go-to home-body booties. Great fit, fabulous memory foam insoles, not too warm and definitely no cold toes. And with enough of a sole to scrounge around the basement and garage, even grocery runs or a latte, I'm digging these boots for the burbs.
review.name: Great booties for the burbs

review.itemreviewed: Flannel Lined Venture Long-Sleeve Jumpsuit - Women's
review.reviewBody: The cinching only cinches the flannel on the inside not seen from the outside. If that makes sense. Seems like a design flaw. I have another Stoic jumpsuit and it cinches the back giving it shape and looks cute. This flannel jumpsuite has no shape even though you are cinched on the inside and it's comfortable. I want to love it.
review.name: Comfortable but....

review.itemreviewed: Flannel Lined Venture Long-Sleeve Jumpsuit - Women's
review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable and well made. The inner cinch straps make it FEEL nice and cinched in - if they weren’t there i would feel like saggy butt -  but they don’t do anything for the figure on the outside. I still look like I am wearing a bear suit. Which is fine I guess since I will be working in them and it is not a fashion show. A little awkward as my top is a medium and my bottom would likely be a small because my entire (size 7) feet are covered by the hilariously wide legs. But the stretch is perfect and i can throw them on over a base layer pant and a puffy jacket and not feel all bunched up and restricted like with so many other women cut “work” clothes (skinny/tight) I am 5’3” tall and got a medium (broad shoulder 38C chest would not fit a smaller size) - they are pretty ok for me. Better for someone a few inches taller  - I also have not washed them they will hopefully shrink a bit.
review.name: Great! I think….

name: Flannel Lined Venture Long-Sleeve Jumpsuit - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great backpack - for work or play. The roll top makes it very accommodating.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a trip I was going on and it’s the perfect size. It’s very comfortable and has lots of great storage pockets without being overwhelming. I also like the roll top feature so that you can fit more or less in depending on your needs.
review.name: Comfy and perfect size!

review.reviewBody: The rolltop feature is great and I like the side entry pocket for documents, small items. It is comfortable and will fit under the seat on an airplane (unless you fill it close to its max). Main "negatives: the key fob shouldn't be in the main bag since it is difficult to find when there are other items, and the stuff pocket needs to expand out a bit more (even a pair of gloves is a tight fit).

review.reviewBody: Been using for work travel and every day for my laptop. Protected my laptop when my house was destroyed in a tornado. I figured the interior of the bag would be wet after all the rain but when I pulled it out of the rubble the interior was dry.
review.name: Great work bag

review.reviewBody: I use this backpack for game nights. I love the internal organization and extra pockets on the front. The padded straps are *actually* comfortable to wear. The side pocket for a water bottle is surprisingly stretchy; I wouldn't recommend stuffing a Nalgene in there, but you could definitely do it.

review.reviewBody: I literally can’t get enough of this jacket and it arrive just in time for Denver’s first snow. Everyone who hugs me won’t let go because of its soft teddy bear feel.
review.name: Ultra Cozy Fleece Jacket

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. The small fit oerfectly. I am 5'4" 125 pounds. The jacket is very stylish and warm. The jacket will look dressed up with jeans and looks great with the beyond yoga brown leggings I bought to go with it. Love, Love, Love.
review.name: Ultimate style and comfort

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket it is very pretty and true to size .The color is amazing
review.name: I love this jacket it

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Nano 18L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great bag! My only critique so far would be that the slot in the back (which I believe is intended for hydration) is a little narrow for the 13-inch laptop I stash there. But I don't think that's the purpose of that slot.
review.name: Nice bag!

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for my new needs, very good construction, zippers are easy to use (have small pull handles) waiting to try out hydration pack next summer. Very happy with my purchase.
Great smaller pack. Good for a day hike or lite use. I love the yellow color too.
review.name: Nano 18

review.reviewBody: I like the price point of this pack; however, although it is listed as an 18 litre pack, its volume capacity is much less than my other Gregory 18 litre pack. So, not this was not quite was I was expecting. Also, wish there was a rain cover for packs this size.
review.name: Truly 18 litre volume?

review.reviewBody:
The Gregory team is incredible. 
Exceptional service.

To those who are looking for a daypack/camel back, look no farther,  the nano 18 is perfect. I made my decision while watching survivor man, he purposefully allowed the Gregory logo in the video because he stated of all the backpacks used in survival Gregory was and is the best/most comfortable and durable. I’ve only had mine for a few weeks and I can vouch for my above statement!!! No regrets!!
review.name: Go Gregory

review.reviewBody: I love searching for small backpacks that can be used for either hiking or normal life (ipads, journals, books, etc.). This one might be my favorite yet out of all the options. Especially if you get the water blatter for those long hikes. I was worried the back would be hot with the foam (even with the holes) but I have not noticed it at all. Extremely usable and comfortable.
review.name: Perfect Multi-Use Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Let me start by saying that I am a 74 yr. old hiker and have been hiking for almost 25 years. I have used the Gregory Jade 28 for many years. I decided on the Nano 18 because it's lighter with less bulk. I discovered that the smaller the pack, the less you take! Imagine that! 
The Nano holds my 3 liter bladder, a nice lunch, a 14 oz. Nalgene with an electrolyte drink, 2 light Smartwool tops and a rainjacket, as well as a first aid packet and a few other things: light Smarwool beanie, gloves, and my eyeglass case. It seems to do the trick! I'm happy with it and will keep it! I do like the Gregory packs! Thanks!
review.name: It's a keeper!

review.reviewBody: Love all my Gregory gear and this is just what we needed.  Great product, great company and great service.
review.name: Love my Gregory Gear!!!

review.reviewBody: Got this backpack before a vacation to use it for short hikes in nature and long days walking around cities and it was perfect. Just the right amount of space, super comfortable to wear all day, and love the colors.
review.name: Great backpack for hiking or travel

name: Nano 18L Backpack

review.reviewBody: These pants somehow ripped from sitting on my poles on the lift first day on the hill. Disappointing for a 50/50 pant. Great color, fit and pockets, but the material durability leaves a lot to be desired.
review.name: Durability issues

review.reviewBody: I love the subtle pink color of these. But they are also a very high quality technical shell pant. Reinforced where needed. Good material. Good looking. 6’ 195lbs, butt. Size large. Refreshing to see from Flylow considering I find their choice of colors typically dark, drab and REI.
review.name: Love these pants

review.reviewBody:
I've gotten 3 different pairs of Baker Bibs throughout the years and wanted to try a regular pant from Flylow. The Chemical pants are basically the same durable materials and feel, just without the bib. I got the Large because I like them to fit a little baggy around the legs, just my preference. True to size though. 
Highly recommend these to anyone wanting to try some regular Flylow pants!!
review.name: Pant version of Baker Bib

review.reviewBody: If you are looking for a durable pair of pants that will last your for multiple seasons, these are for you! I am a ski bum that shreds 100+ days a season and I live in these pants all day everyday in the winter. I wake up in the morning in my bus conversion and put these on, shred all day, and then they stay on till the day is over and I am crawling back into bed! Stoked to have high quality pants that last for folks like me!
review.name: Most durable pants out there!

review.reviewBody:
I can't knock the quality.  Flylow makes great gear and these pants are no exception.  That said, the Medium is HUGE.  I'm a pretty solid Medium when it comes to bottoms and wear 30-32" waist trousers depending upon the brand.  Even with the velcro straps cinched as tight as possible, the Chemical Pants were too big.  The legs are oversized too.  It's not a flattering cut.  Lots of fabric bunching up in places.  

If you like a super baggy pants, these might be right for you.  I suggest sizing down.  I was also disappointed with the color.  The Vista color is not accurate on any of my devices.  Not only is the color a deeper green in person, it's more muted and dull.  The closest color comparison I can make is when you get a sinus infection and your snot turns green.  It's that kind of green.

I'm still giving the pants four stars because they seem to be great quality.  Knocking off one star for ridiculous sizing and wildly inaccurate color.  I considered trying a size Small, but deep down I don't believe the cut is to my liking.
review.name: Great quality, poor fit, size issues

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'9" tall and 160 pounds. Got the medium last February and thought they fit great. A little baggy, but not "snowboard baggy".
I ski telemark and get in an average of 8 or 9 bump runs per day over the course of 80 to 90 days per year. I also have my skis sharpened to a razor sharp 1 degree bottom bevel and 3 degree side bevel, so my ski pants get shredded pretty easily. 
These were better than most, but recently I sent them to Flylow with another pair to have the cuffs replaced and the two pairs of pants, including shipping back were $30 to repair. That seems like a very fair price. 
Anyway, they breath well, I like the extra reinforcement at the knees and they look good with good ventilation while keeping me dry and warm even with the wild swings in body temperature you get skiing telemark.
review.name: Great pants - great service from Flylow

review.reviewBody: Still the most rugged
review.name: 2020 Chemical Pant video
comment: are the pants in this video the Rye color available right now? They look very different, so not sure if these are a previous year's pant or not.

review.reviewBody: These, as others have stated, are rather baggy and long.  A good 2-3" longer than my Flylow Magnum Pro Pants, which fit great, but two years in, aren't as waterproof as they once were.  Anyways, these pants are probably cool if you're at least 6'.
review.name: Should have listed to the other reviews

review.reviewBody: I wore my old Chemical pants for eight seasons of 50-100 days a season and couldn’t ask for more so it was a no brained to get another pair. I bought the same size (large) but the new ones are three inches longer and baggier all around so I will be exchanging for a medium. More importantly there is a small housing for the outer leg vent made out of seam tape that is very rigid and it cut the back of my knee after a day of touring; not cool. The last problem I had with the fit is that the low hanging crotch was restricting for kick turns without having them pulled up to my belly button. I really hope these issues will be resolved by going down a size since I loved my old Chemical Pants but as is they were a let down.
review.name: Fit larger and cut my leg

name: Chemical Pant - Men's
